intro: Dehaasia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy dehaasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun exposure. Its hairy stems and leaves help it retain moisture in arid environments. Dehaasia hirsuta is often found in savannah and woodland habitats.
